definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb

sentences.english: We are busy preparing the land for sowing.
sentences.chinese: 我们忙于平整土地，准备播种。

sentences.english: They act as small laminated springs and keep the belt strap flat.

sentences.english: After 12 weeks, in the compound group, the articular surface was flat, the joint space was normal;
sentences.chinese: 植入后12周，复合组关节面平整，关节间隙如常。

sentences.english: Automatically adjustable cutting space, flat veneer and good smoothness.

sentences.english: The special design also allows the unit to be neatly flush-mounted in desktops.

sentences.english: All you want is enough chopped off to make it squared off and straight.
sentences.chinese: 你需要的只是把毛边切掉，使之成为平整的四方形。

sentences.english: First draw out your EVE on a sheet of plain white cotton.
sentences.chinese: 首先，在一张平整的白色棉布上绘制出伊娃的外形。

sentences.english: D. ). The city is divided into 9 parts. The streets are broad and neat.
sentences.chinese: 城内分为9个市区，街道宽阔平整，规划整齐。

sentences.english: It is accessible from Wah Sing Street and is around the periphery of the formed platforms of the existing buildings.

sentences.english: The highway that connect a village built very spacious, neat, color cement pavement.

sentences.english: If you do this the inside cover of your paper will be smooth, if you don't there is a chance there will be a line resulting from the edge of the manilla.

sentences.english: Site-leveling also has different meanings by the ways of thinking or conducting.
sentences.chinese: 土地平整这“平”，也包括不同的理解和执行。

sentences.english: The triple-glazed facade is trimmed in wood framing.
sentences.chinese: 三层的玻璃立面平整地嵌入木框架。

definition: according to a pattern/regular/orderly/structured/neat and tidy
to spruce up/to renovate/to tend (a garden)/to groom (one's hair)/to finish (a rough surface)/to trim (a lawn)/to touch up (a photo)
flexible/not rigid/spongy/soft or runny (not set hard)/loose (soil)
